text.section: In this subtitle the following words have the meanings indicated.

"Building" means:
any new structure with an area of at least 5,000 square feet;
any change to an existing structure that:
will add at least 10% gross floor space to the structure and has an estimated construction cost of more than $25,000; or
constitutes a major renovation; or
any structure with an area of at least 5,000 square feet that is leased or owned by the State.

"Energy-consumption analysis" means an evaluation, by type and amount of energy used, of:
each piece of equipment that serves a building, including any piece of equipment that is used:
to cool the building;
to heat the building; or
to heat water used in the building;
each piece of equipment on the building site that is:
used to generate electricity for the building; or
powered, in whole or in part, by coal, electricity, natural gas, oil, sun, or wind; and
each conservation measure included in the building that decreases the energy requirements of the building.

"Energy performance index" means a number that:
describes the energy requirements of a building measured at the building boundaries under defined internal and external ambient conditions over an entire seasonal cycle; and
is stated either:
per square foot of floor space in the building; or
per cubic foot of occupied volume of the building.
"Life of the building" has the meaning established by the Department under § 4-808 of this subtitle.
"Primary procurement unit" has the meaning provided in § 11-101 of this article.
